meanings.definition: Not automatic; requiring manual operation or control.
meanings.sent1: The old car had nonautomatic windows that needed to be rolled down by hand.
meanings.sent2: The nonautomatic door lock had to be manually turned to open the door.
meanings.sent3: The nonautomatic coffee maker refused to brew until someone pressed the start button.
meanings.sent4: Her nonautomatic watch seemed to tick louder than the automatic ones, reminding her of simpler times.
meanings.sent5: The nonautomatic traffic lights caused chaos when the power went out, requiring police officers to direct traffic.

meanings.definition: Not occurring or functioning spontaneously or automatically.
meanings.sent1: The nonautomatic sprinkler system needed to be turned on manually during dry spells.
meanings.sent2: The nonautomatic email reply left her waiting for a response that never came.
meanings.sent3: The nonautomatic soap dispenser dispensed soap only when the button was pressed, surprising the guests.
meanings.sent4: His nonautomatic memory kicked in just in time to remember her birthday without any reminders.
meanings.sent5: The nonautomatic car wash required customers to select each wash option individually, making it a unique experience.
